Hospitalization Record.Chief Complaint: Intermittent abdominal colic, constipation, and abdominal distension for 3 days.

Present Illness.Onset: Onset occurred three days ago at home, sudden in nature with no identifiable triggers.
Present Illness.Main Symptoms: Experiencing intermittent abdominal colic, reduced appetite, constipation, vomiting, inability to pass stool or flatus, and pronounced abdominal distension. Pain severity: 7/10, worsens post-meal, partially relieved by positioning.
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Nausea and occasional vomiting, no fever, no chills, no significant weight loss noted.
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: Patient self-administered over-the-counter laxatives without relief. No prior hospitalizations for similar symptoms.
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Appetite significantly reduced, difficulty sleeping due to discomfort, no recent weight change, urination normal.

Past History.Disease History: Hypertension for 10 years, controlled with medication.
Past History.Infectious Disease History: No significant history of infectious diseases.

Personal History.Living Habits: Non-smoker, occasional wine consumption, diet low in fiber.
Personal History.Occupation and Working Conditions: Retired teacher, no known work-related health issues.
Personal History.Exposure History: No known exposure to industrial toxins, dust, or radioactive substances.

Marital and Family History.Family History: Mother had similar digestive issues in old age; father deceased due to stroke; one sibling diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.

Systematic Examination.Chest: Clear bilateral breath sounds, no wheezes or crackles, heart sounds normal, no murmurs
Systematic Examination.Abdomen: Distended, hyperactive bowel sounds, diffuse tenderness, no rebound tenderness, liver and spleen not palpable
Systematic Examination.Limbs: No edema, normal range of motion

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Surgical consultation recommended for possible intestinal obstruction.
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: Abdominal X-ray showed distended bowel loops with air-fluid levels, indicative of obstruction.
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Based on history of intermittent abdominal colic, constipation, inability to pass stool or flatus, and supportive imaging studies.
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Acute perforation of gastric or duodenal ulcer ruled out due to absence of history and systemic signs; acute cholecystitis and pancreatitis less likely due to imaging findings; acute appendicitis ruled out given absence of fixed lower right abdominal tenderness.

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Patient admitted with suspected intestinal obstruction based on symptoms and initial imaging. Initial management includes nil per os (NPO), intravenous fluids, and nasogastric tube insertion. Pending further evaluation and surgical consultation.
Post-Admission Course Records.Daily Course Records: Day 2: Symptoms persist, maintaining NPO status, continued IV fluids, and monitoring. Day 3: Slight improvement in abdominal distension, tolerated small sips of water, planned gradual reintroduction of diet.
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Reviewed by senior physician Dr. L. Wang; agreed with ongoing management plan, no surgical intervention required at present.
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Handover to on-call team completed with detailed overview of the case, current management plan, and pending evaluations.
Post-Admission Course Records.Stage Summary: Patient showing signs of improvement on conservative management. Gradual reintroduction of diet initiated.
Post-Admission Course Records.Invasive Procedure Records: Nasogastric tube insertion performed for decompression.
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Surgical consultation confirmed no immediate need for surgical intervention.

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: NPO, IV Fluids (Normal Saline 0.9%), Nasogastric Tube Suction, Bed Rest
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: Abdominal X-ray, Complete Blood Count, Basic Metabolic Panel

Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination Reports: Complete Blood Count showed mild leukocytosis; Basic Metabolic Panel within normal limits.

Digestive System Diseases.Name: Intestinal Obstruction
Digestive System Diseases.Symptoms: Intermittent abdominal colic, decreased appetite, constipation, vomiting, inability to pass stool or flatus, abdominal distension
Digestive System Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Acute perforation of gastric or duodenal ulcer (usually with a history of long-term digestive tract ulcers), acute cholecystitis complicated by gallbladder stones, acute pancreatitis, acute appendicitis (fixed point tenderness in the lower right abdomen)
